result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph A Okray III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If the defendant is revoked off of probation and this sentence is executed, the defendant will be eligible for good time.

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice. 
2) All costs, fees, and other surcharges have been paid in full from the bond funds posted in this matter. 
3) The court waived all court costs in this matter except for the DNA surcharge.

1) Defendant shall not vote in any election until their civil rights are restored. 
2) The defendant shall not use or possess any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Alcohol use is at the agent's discretion.
3) The defendant shall not associate with anyone on active supervision for drug-related offenses.
4) The defendant shall not reside with anyone on active supervision for any criminal offenses.
Defendant shall not use or possess firearms for life.
The defendant must complete an AODA and comply with any treatment that may be recommended.

1) The defendant shall undergo regular drug testing.
2) If the defendant is fully compliant with all conditions of probation, he may petition to discharge off of probation early at his DOC agent's discretion.

Burnett County case 22TR104 is DRI.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph A Okray III

defendant.name: Okray, Joseph A, III
defendant.address: 23923 County Rd H, Shell Lake, WI 54871

records.addlTxt:
2:59 PM Cases 22CF33 and 22TR104 called together.  Defendant Joseph A Okray III in court.  Attorney Thomas O. Mulligan Jr. in court for Joseph A Okray III.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Mulligan: def pleading to Ct 2: possession of meth; Cts 1 and 3 to be dismissed, non-jail disposition, 3 yrs probation, dismiss TR case, no PSI.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea. Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 2 and orders a JOC remaining counts and cases are DRI.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def makes a statement to the Court.  
Court orders:
1 year probation, 4 months jail imposed/stayed; if def does not violate any conditions of probation, he may petition to discharge early at agent's discretion.  1 day jail credit.
Assesses $250 DNA only court costs, bond to apply.  Waives all other costs.
Conditions of probation:
Regular drug testing, AODA and follow-through, no association with people who are on active probation for any drug related offenses.  No residing with anyone on probation for criminal offenses.  Absolute sobriety- No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Alcohol use at agent's discretion.  Firearms and voting restrictions given.
Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.

Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: requesting plea/sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
